6856306.trustfund:
TF025439-PHRD -MICRO FINANCE AND SMALL
            ENTERPRISE DEVELOPMENT
6856306.majtheme: Financial and private sector development,Rule of law

abstracts.cdata!:
The Micro-finance Capacity-Building
            Project aims to test a performance-based capacity-building
            program methodology that will contribute to transforming
            three financial institutions from donor-financed development
            projects into sustainable financial institutions that are
            appropriately regulated by the Central Bank of Guinea. The
            three micro-finance institutions are Credit Rural (a rural
            community-based credit scheme), Credit Mutuel (a credit
            union-type of structure that caters to small businessmen,
            traders, and civil servants), and Le Programme Integre pour
            le Developpement de l'Entreprise (PRIDE) (a traditional
            micro-finance nongovernmental organization focusing on
            women-owned informal activities and enterprises). There are
            three components. The first sets up a micro-finance support
            and monitoring unit which manages a general
            performance-based institution building program that trains
            central bank staff in financial and institutional
            management, and builds model credit unions. The second
            component consists of specialized assistance for each
            institution in the form of investments, specialized
            consulting, and performance-based incentives. Specifically,
            capacity-building for the staff of the three institutions
            will entail advisory assistance and short-term consultants,
            training, and equipment.
